title: Bug 120922 - 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed asking the user if they want to save the changes. The options presented are: 'Yes' to save the changes, 'No' to discard the changes, and 'Cancel' to remain on the Source page. The dialog displaying these options is titled 'Error'. However, the error message is not clear and includes unnecessary quotation marks. The user is left unsure about how to save or discard their changes. It would be helpful to improve the error message and remove the unnecessary quotation marks to provide clearer instructions to the user.
OB: When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and trying to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed stating 'Source page is dirty.' The user is then prompted with options to save, discard, or cancel the changes, but the instructions on how to proceed are unclear.
EB: When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and trying to switch back to the Layout view, an error message should clearly state that the 'Source page is dirty' and provide explicit instructions on how to save or discard the changes. The dialog should be titled 'Error' without unnecessary quotation marks.
SR:
1. Open the XML Report Designer.
2. Switch to the 'source' view of the Layout Editor.
3. Make changes to the XML.
4. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view.
5. Observe the error message stating the page is dirty.
6. Verify that the options to save, discard, or cancel the changes are displayed clearly.
7. Verify that the dialog is titled 'Error' without unnecessary quotation marks.
